newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia Lek signs deal with Yugoslav Jugoremedija.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia Lek signs deal with Yugoslav Jugoremedija.

text.p: Slovenian pharmaceutical firm Lek said on Friday it had signed its first contract with a rump Yugoslavia company since the break-up of Yugoslavia in 1991.
"We signed a licence contract with Jugoremedija by which Jugoremedija will produce six of our medicines for the market of the new Yugoslavia," Lek's deputy chief executive Simon Oblak told Reuters.
He said the deal was pending approval by the Yugoslav Ministry of Economic Relations.
"We hope production will start this year," Oblak said.
The deal was signed in Belgrade on Monday.
Oblak said Lek's sales to other states of the former Yugoslavia, which represented about 40 percent of all sales before the break-up of the former federation, fell to only 16.8 percent by 1995.
He said Lek hoped to improve these sales significantly although it would be unrealistic to believe they could return to levels reached before 1991.
Lek is listed on the primary market of the Ljubljana bourse and was last traded on Wednesday when its share price firmed 0.64 percent to 12,479 tolars.
